result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Elias Q. Shannon

defendant.name: Shannon, Elias Q.
defendant.address: 2023 Country Club Dr, Stevens Point, WI 54481

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Elias Q. Shannon in court with attorney Acalia Halverson. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 15CM48, 15CM49, 15CM211, 15TR1055, 15TR1056
11:25 a.m. Court calls the cases. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CM48 Count 2 - NO CONTEST
15CM49 Count 1 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court accepts the defendant pleas on 15CM48 Count 2 and 15CM49 Count 1, but does not find the defendant guilty at this time because of his acceptance into the VIP program.
15CM48 Count 1, 15CM49 Count 2, 
15CM211, 15TR1055 and 15TR1056 are dismissed and read-in. 

Atty Knaapen makes arguments to the Court. 
Atty Halverson makes arguments to the Court. 

Court questions the defendant. 

BY THE COURT:
Placed in the VIP program for a period of 9 months:
20 hours community service.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Not use non-prescription medication. 
Day report with alcohol and drug testing at level determined by the case manager.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Maintain fulltime employment, go to school fulltime or combination to equal fulltime.

Defendant Elias Q. Shannon in court with attorney Acalia Halverson. ADA Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties. 
P/NG entered.
Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 12, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold.
Comply with all other non-monetary bond conditions previously imposed.

ADA David Knaapen appears in Court.  
Defendant (d.o.b. 07-27-1996) appears from jail by video.
Acalia Halverson is present in the Courtroom. 

ADA Knaapen states facts for anticipated charges of Bai Jumping.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
State requests a $100 cash bond with conditions as stated.
Atty Halverson makes statements re: bond. 

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  5/26/15  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 3
